thread.title: IL: Dinosaur rocks Cubs jersey before wildcard game
thread.title_full: IL: Dinosaur rocks Cubs jersey before wildcard game

title: IL: Dinosaur rocks Cubs jersey before wildcard game
text:
IL: Dinosaur rocks Cubs jersey before wildcard game - Tucson News Now Member Center: IL: Dinosaur rocks Cubs jersey before wildcard game Posted: Updated: A museum dinosaur in Chicago shows support for the Cubs by wearing the team’s jersey. (Source: WGN/CNN) 
CHICAGO (WGN/CNN) - The Chicago Cubs are in the Major League Baseball Playoffs for the first time in seven years. 
And it seems everyone and everything in the Windy City has baseball fever. 
The iconic dinosaur outside Chicago’s Field Museum is wearing a Cub’s jersey. 
But playoff fever could be short-lived. 
The Cubs play the Pittsburgh Pirates Wednesday night in a one-game wildcard series to determine who will advance to the next playoff round. 
Copyright 2015 WGN via CNN. All rights reserved. Keuchel sharp, Astros beat Yankees 3-0 in AL wild-card game Dallas Keuchel pitched three-hit ball for six baffling innings, Colby Rasmus and Carlos Gomez each homered, and the Houston Astros beat the New York Yankees 3-0 Tuesday night in the American League wild-card game. A year ago, no one could've pictured this. Yet here they were, Dallas Keuchel and the Houston Astros, soaking in champagne, merrily posing for a victory shot on the mound at Yankee Stadium.
